Product Title: Psycho: Complete 4-Movie Collection [DVD]
Review Date: 2019/11/03
Store: Anthony Perkins  (Actor, Director),     Janet Leigh  (Actor),     Mick Garris  (Director),     Richard Franklin  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Horror
Product Description: ['Check into the motel where guests never check out in the Psycho: Complete 4-Movie Collection, featuring all four thrillers starring Anthony Perkins as the notorious Norman Bates – including the iconic original directed by the Master of Suspense, Alfred Hitchcock. In Psycho, a secretary (Janet Leigh) checks into the remote Bates Motel run by a shy young man (Perkins) with what appears to be a domineering mother. In Psycho II, Norman returns to his family home after 22 years only to be haunted by his past. Old habits die hard when Norman falls for a former nun and angers his jealous mother in Psycho III. Finally, in Psycho IV: The Beginning, Norman calls in to a late-night radio show and shares disturbing memories of his childhood with Mother.', 'Bonus Content:', 'Disc 1 - Psycho (1960):', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Re-Release Trailers', 'Re-Release Trailers', 'Newsreel Footage: The Release of Psycho', 'Newsreel Footage: The Release of Psycho', 'The Shower Scene', 'The Shower Scene', 'The Psycho Archives', 'The Psycho Archives', 'Production Photographs', 'Production Photographs', 'Behind-the-Scenes Photographs', 'Behind-the-Scenes Photographs', 'The Shower Scene: Storyboards by Saul Bass', 'The Shower Scene: Storyboards by Saul Bass', 'Lobby Cards', 'Lobby Cards', 'Posters and Psycho Ads', 'Posters and Psycho Ads', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Disc 2 - Psycho II:', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Disc 3 - Psycho III:', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', ']]>']

reference_summary:
Intouchables
François Cluzet  (Actor),     Omar Sy  (Actor),     Eric Toledano  (Director),     Olivier Nakache  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'When Driss, an ex-con from the projects, is hired to take care of an eccentric French aristocrat named Philippe, his newfound job quickly becomes an unpredictable adventure. Speeding a Maserati through Paris, seducing women and paragliding over the Alps is just the beginning, as Driss turns the often humorous world of upper-class Parisian society upside-down. As this unlikely duo overcome adversity of every flavor in this true story, they also shatter their preconceptions of love, life and each other. Based on the #1 international best-selling book, “You Changed My Life.”', 'Amazon.com', "Driss (Omar Sy), a Senegalese man living in a Paris slum, applies for a job as caretaker to a wealthy quadriplegic, but all he wants is to get his paper stamped so he can get benefits. Despite his lack of qualifications, he lands the job because of his attitude: Philippe (François Cluzet), the quadriplegic, wants a caretaker who will look at him without pity. As Driss reluctantly learns to move, feed, and clean Philippe, the two men discover a blunt but vital humor that not only bridges the cultural and class divide between them, but gives Philippe a renewed joy in life. It's easy to see what made", 'The Intouchables', "such a massive success in France; the movie has the sweet sincerity and uplifting conclusion that make for a classic feel-good experience. The chemistry between the two leads is undeniable, and Sy--who won the French equivalent of the Oscar for his role--is a dynamic and charismatic performer, while Cluzet's understated performance conveys Philippe's frustrations. The movie doesn't dig too deeply into the struggles of life as a quadriplegic or the struggles of life among the inner-city poor, so when", 'The Intouchables', "ends it's not likely to leave a lasting impression, but that doesn't get in the way of its immediate charm and warmth.", '--Bret Fetzer']

One of the absolutly best movies that I have ever seen.  Could have watched  Omar Sy dance for hours and hours  When I think that my like is difficult, all I have to do is watch a few minutes of this movie to feel truly blessed.
Wonderful, wonderful movie

["For two years the Civil War has been elsewhere. Now Confederate forces are nearby, looting and burning. It is time to fight back, Jess Birdwell's neighbors insist. Yet Birdwell, a Quaker, knows there must be a better way to settle things."]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user has a strong affinity for heartfelt and uplifting films, particularly those that blend drama and comedy, emphasizing deep emotional connections and the transformative power of friendship. They consistently value narratives that challenge social norms and inspire personal growth and resilience. Recent interactions indicate a growing appreciation for classic cinema, especially iconic performances, which now includes an interest in horror and suspense genres.

The user enjoys purchasing films that resonate with friends, underscoring their desire to share meaningful narratives and experiences, which highlights their emphasis on community and connection in their viewing habits. Their recent engagement with classic horror underscores a willingness to explore diverse genres, while maintaining their core preference for emotionally rich storytelling.

Key trends include:
- **Genre Preference:** Drama, comedy, and now horror and suspense, with a focus on feel-good narratives and classic cinema elements.
- **Emotional Resonance:** Enjoyment of films that inspire warmth and evoke gratitude while exploring life’s challenges.
- **Performance Appreciation:** An admiration for dynamic lead performances, especially from classic and iconic actors.
- **Personal Impact:** The user seeks films that foster connections with friends and provide perspective on life’s complexities.

Overall, the user finds joy in cinematic experiences that inspire reflection, resilience, and a renewed appreciation for life, while continuing to deepen relationships through shared narratives.
